en: Dear Diary, dear Future Jerry, dear Anybody Else who is reading this, my name is Jerry Grey and I have a story.
zh: 親愛的日記，親愛的未來的傑瑞，親愛的正在讀日記的任何人，我的名字是傑瑞·格雷，我有一個故事。

en: I am a father, a husband, a crime writer, a gunshot survivor, I have Alzheimer’s, and I am a convicted killer.
zh: 我是一個父親，一個丈夫，一個犯罪小說家，一個槍傷倖存者，我有阿爾茨海默病，我是一個犯下滔天罪行的兇手。

en: I murdered my wife. I don’t remember killing her, and I don’t know whether to be grateful for Captain A hiding that from me or not.
zh: 我殺死了我的妻子，但我不記得殺了她，我不知道是否要因為「阿爾茨船長」對我隱瞞了真相而要感謝他。

en: I live in a psychiatric facility with bars on the windows and locks on the doors and gray walls in every direction.
zh: 我住在一個滿是瘋子的精神病院里，窗戶上有鐵柵欄，門全部上鎖，到處是灰色的牆壁。

en: Sometimes I have questions, and sometimes the doctors answer them, and sometimes I don’t believe what I’m hearing, and sometimes to prove their point they’ll show me a copy of the confession note I wrote.
zh: 有時我會問一些問題，醫生偶爾會回答；有時我不相信我親耳聽到的，為了證明他們的觀點，他們會給我看我寫的懺悔書。

en: Other times they’ll show me the newspaper articles too.
zh: 其他時間，他們也會讓我看報紙上的文章。

en: On days when they don’t have time to answer my questions, they just medicate me.
zh: 他們不回答我問題的時候，他們只給我治療。

en: It’s easier that way. For them, and for me.
zh: 這很簡單，對於他們，對於我。

en: They tell me I’ve been here a year now.
zh: 他們告訴我說我已經在這裏住一年了。

en: This is day one of keeping a diary, which I’m doing in an attempt to keep my sanity, of which there is very little left.
zh: 今天是寫日記的第一天，我在努力讓自己保持清醒，保持理智，但這樣的時日已所剩不多。

en: Though, really, I think it’s more of an attempt to preserve some of the man I used to be. It wasn’t my idea, but the idea of one of the doctors.
zh: 雖然，我認為我是在努力找回之前的我，但這並不是我的想法，而是醫生的想法。

en: He thinks it may help.
zh: 他認為這有助於我的康復。

en: Sadly, the man I used to be is a monster.
zh: 可悲的是，我以前是一個怪物。

en: I killed a lot of people. I killed my wife. I killed a florist who worked on my daughter’s wedding. I killed my best friend, Hans, I killed a woman who used to be my neighbor, and I also killed an orderly at the nursing home where I used to live.
zh: 我殺了很多人，我殺了我的妻子，殺了參与準備我女兒婚禮的花店老闆，殺了我最好的朋友漢斯，我還殺了我以前的女鄰居，殺了我過去居住在養老院里的護理員。

en: There are diaries, I’ve been told, that I’ve kept in the past, but the police have them now.
zh: 有人告訴我，我保存著過去寫的日記，但它們現在在警察手上。

en: Some days I think those diaries might tell me I’m innocent, other days I think they just confirm what I wrote in the confession. It means all the things I don’t want to be true are, indeed, true.
zh: 有時我覺得那些日記可能會告訴我我是無辜的，有時我認為他們只是想確認我在懺悔書中寫過的東西，這意味著我並不希望是真實的事情的確真實存在過。

en: Yet the only person I can remember killing is Suzan.
zh: 然而，我唯一能記得被我殺死的人是蘇姍，她喜歡把「珊」寫成「姍」。

en: When I try to think of these people, their names and faces all fade into a murky past, but not hers.
zh: 當我回想這些人時，他們的名字和面孔都消失在陰暗的過去，唯獨她的沒有。

en: I remember quite clearly standing in the backyard of her house, the moon bright and full, I remember embracing the night and feeling the blood pulse through my body as the need took me over.
zh: 我記得很清楚，我站在她家後院，月亮格外明亮、圓潤，黑夜在擁抱著我，我渾身的熱血在沸騰，奢望已佔據我全部的心靈。

en: I had wanted Suzan from the moment I first saw her. I wanted to know how she felt.
zh: 我從第一次見到蘇姍時就想佔有她，我想知道她的感覺。

en: So, Diary, I’m going to tell you all about it.
zh: 所以，日記，我要告訴你所有這一切。

en: But first . . . I don’t really like the name Diary.
zh: 但首先……我真的不喜歡「日記」這個名稱。

en: I’ve been thinking of Madness Diary, but that doesn’t quite fit.
zh: 我想過用「狂人日記」，但也不太適合。

en: I’ll think about it and see what else I can come up with.
zh: 我會考慮考慮，看看我能想出什麼名字。

en: Future Jerry, let me tell you about Suzan.
zh: 未來的傑瑞，讓我跟你說說蘇姍。

en: Madness Diary, let me tell you how my life as a killer began. . . .
zh: 「狂人日記」，讓我告訴你我的殺手生涯是如何開始的……
